EXTRACTED VALUE: Kendrick Perkins said in a recent interview that he hopes to return from ACL surgery in mid-February.
Yao Ming (leg) and Aaron Brooks (ankle) are still weeks away from returning, according to coach Rick Adelman.
Ronny Turiaf (knee) is officially out for Friday's game.
According to Raptors radio play-by-play man Paul Jones, Reggie Evans has a non-displaced fracture of the fifth metatarsal on his right foot.
The Pistons and veteran free agent Ben Wallace have reportedly agreed to a two-year deal.
Pacers center Jeff Foster (sprained right ankle) is on schedule to return to the lineup next week.
Al Jefferson, who missed Thursday's practice with a sore back, will start for the Jazz on Friday.
Heat PF Juwan Howard (shoulder soreness) did not practice on Sunday but should be ready for Tuesday's opener, according to coach Erik Spoelstra.
Pau Gasol will play in Friday's game against the Kings, but could be limited if his hamstring begins to act up.
Nenad Krstic will miss Friday's game with back spasms.
Carlos Boozer reported no soreness or pain in his right hand following his season debut on Wednesday.
Hawks coach Mike Woodson regrets his decision to use just six players in the second half of Friday's game.
As expected, the Suns have signed center Earl Barron.
Coach George Karl said that Kenyon Martin (knee) could be ready to play by January 1.
Dwight Howard (stomach virus) has officially been ruled out of Friday's game.
Chris Kaman came up limping during Sunday's game and may have aggravated his sprained ankle.
Chris Wilcox (hamstring) will sit out again on Friday when the Pistons face the Thunder.
Ryan Hollins has reportedly been suspended for two games for throwing a forearm at Dirk Nowitzki and throwing a punch at DeShawn Stevenson on Monday.
Samuel Dalembert (knee) will start on Friday against the Lakers.
Renaldo Balkman is hoping to return to practice Friday, a key step towards recovery from a bulging disk in his back.
Starting in place of Kenyon Martin (knee) once again, Johan Petro had 10 points and 10 rebounds in Friday's win over the Hornets.
Brian Skinner was not included as a part of the Antawn Jamison trade, as previously reported by league sources.
Nene Hilario scored 17 points on 7-of-9 shooting with five rebounds and three assists in 30 minutes of action on Tuesday.
Shaquille O'Neal was an unexcused absence from Monday's practice. Doc Rivers said the team has dealt with the situation and moved on.
DeSagana Diop was held from Wednesday night's game but this was due to coach's decision, not injury.
Chris Andersen (knee) came out of Monday's debut feeling good.
Eddy Curry (hamstring) participated in 3-on-3 drills Monday.
Former Hornets big man Melvin Ely will join the Nuggets during training camp this year, as they look to fill out their frontcourt rotation.
Josh Childress played 22 minutes off the bench on Sunday, contributing 11 points on 4-of-9 shooting with six rebounds and two assists.
Andrew Bogut (back) and Larry Sanders will start on Saturday against the Magic, while Drew Gooden (foot) will not play.
Zydrunas Ilgauskas will get the start against the Suns on Wednesday.
Kurt Thomas started at center in place of injured Andrew Bogut on Tuesday, getting four points, 14 rebounds, two assists and one block in 32 minutes.
Suns beat writer Paul Coro reports that Hakim Warrick will start in place of Hedo Turkoglu for Sunday's game against the Nuggets.
Dan Gadzuric will miss Wednesday's game with back spasms.
Theo Ratliff will have arthroscopic surgery on his sore left knee, and no timetable for his return has been announced.
Marcus Camby downplayed his sore right knee Wednesday night, saying he'll be fine.
Malik Allen has been dealing with a strained groin over the last week, but he is probable for Wednesday's game against the Thunder.
Emeka Okafor had zero points (on zero shot attempts), nine rebounds and zero blocks in Wednesday's win over the Bucks.
Zaza Pachulia returned from his hip injury Wednesday and had eight points, seven boards and a block in a win over the Clippers.
Tyson Chandler scored 14 points on 6-of-10 shooting with 17 rebounds and three blocks in the Mavs' win over the Heat on Saturday.
Beat writer Mike Wells speculates that Dahntay Jones could be traded before the season starts.
The Blazers have officially signed veteran F/C Sean Marks.
Craig Smith (back) practiced on Monday but was limited to non-contact drills, and is questionable for Wednesday's season opener.
Antonio McDyess, who is now 35, said recently he is fairly certain this will be his final NBA season.
Amir Johnson, not Joey Dorsey, will start for the Raptors at power forward against the Wizards Wednesday night.
Free agent center Erick Dampier will sign with the Heat on Tuesday.
Coach Alvin Gentry wants to reduce Grant Hill's minutes.
Etan Thomas sat out again on Saturday, though it's not clear if he's injured or just out of the rotation.
Jason Maxiell will start for the Pistons again on Thursday, raising doubt if Austin Daye will even play.
A decision on Elton Brand's possible suspension won't be handed down until Wednesday afternoon.
Kwame Brown has been cleared for contact drills and played a game of 4-on-4 during Thursday's practice.
Coach Larry Brown said that Tyrus Thomas' insertion into the starting lineup Wednesday night was simply matchup based.
Dorell Wright scored two points on 1-of-6 shooting with four rebounds, two assists, and one steal in 31 minutes on Monday.
The Spurs are barely calling their notorious four down play for Tim Duncan this season.
Pacers big man Solomon Jones (elbow) isn't expected to play at Charlotte on Friday.
According to the Belgian media, veteran center D.J. Mbenga has agreed to a one-year deal with the Nuggets.
Warriors big man Louis Amundson has had the splint on his right hand removed but there is still no timetable for his return.
Darius Songaila will play in Wednesday's game against the Grizzlies.
The Hawks are expected to re-sign veteran center Jason Collins, though nothing is imminent since Collins is currently in Europe.
Darko Milicic hit just 2-of-10 shots for four points, six rebounds, four assists and a block before fouling out of Friday's loss to the Spurs.
David Lee started for the Warriors on Saturday after missing eight games due to an elbow infection that led to surgery.
Francisco Elson (hamstring) will not play against the Suns Thursday night.
Anderson Varejao had 10 points, 13 rebounds, a steal and block in Friday's loss to the Hornets.
76ers big man Tony Battie (right knee inflammation) did not practice on Friday and is not expected to play in Saturday's exhibition.
Jermaine O'Neal will not play this week and doesn't sound anywhere close to a return from knee soreness.
Asked about Drew Gooden's (foot) status for Wednesday, Scott Skiles said, I would imagine he's gonna go.
Shaun Livingston (knee) and Gerald Henderson (knee) both say they will be ready for the season opener on Wednesday.
Joel Przybilla (flu) is doubtful for Wednesday's game against the Celtics, but could play Friday against the Wizards.
